info.title: Health Decision Support API
info.description:
Health Decision Support provides an API that serves decision support models,
specific for Health & Life Sciences, that perform a decision support inference
to be used by a human.

parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.description:
Supported Cognitive Services endpoints (protocol and hostname, for example:
https://westus2.api.cognitive.microsoft.com).

post.description: Creates an Onco Phenotype job with the given request body.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The body of an Onco Phenotype request.

202.description: The request has been accepted for processing, but processing has not yet completed.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

Repeatability-Result.description:
"The result of a repeatable request (`accepted`/`rejected`), as specified in 
[OASIS Repeatable Requests Version 1.0](https://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/repeatable-requests/v1.0/cs01/repeatable-requests-v1.0-cs01.html#sec_RepeatabilityResult).

Operation-Location.description: The location of an instance of OperationStatus

get.description: Gets the status and details of the Onco Phenotype job.

post.description: Creates a Trial Matcher job with the given request body.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The body of a Trial Matcher request.

202.description: The request has been accepted for processing, but processing has not yet completed.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

Repeatability-Result.description:
"The result of a repeatable request (`accepted`/`rejected`), as specified in 
[OASIS Repeatable Requests Version 1.0](https://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/repeatable-requests/v1.0/cs01/repeatable-requests-v1.0-cs01.html#sec_RepeatabilityResult).

Operation-Location.description: The location of an instance of OperationStatus

get.description: Gets the status and details of the Trial Matcher job.

unit.description: Possible units for a person's age.

value.description: The number of years/months/days that represents the person's age.

Age.description: A person's age, given as a number (value) and a unit (e.g. years, months)

AgeUnit.description: Possible units for a person's age.

geometry.description: `GeoJSON` geometry, representing the area circle's center.

Area.description:
A geographical area, expressed as a `Circle` geometry represented using a
`GeoJSON Feature` (see [GeoJSON spec](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946)).

coordinates.description:
Coordinates of the area circle's center, represented according to the `GeoJSON` standard.
This is an array of 2 decimal numbers, longitude and latitude (precisely in this order).

AreaGeometry.description: `GeoJSON` geometry, representing the area circle's center.

radius.description: The radius of the area's circle, in meters.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

Azure.Core.Foundations.InnerError.description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Microsoft One API guidelines - https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses.

system.description: The clinical coding system, e.g. ICD-10, SNOMED-CT, UMLS.

code.description: The code within the given clinical coding system.

name.description: The name of this coded concept in the coding system.

value.description: A value associated with the code within the given clinical coding system.

ClinicalCodedElement.description:
A piece of clinical information, expressed as a code in a clinical coding
system.

ClinicalDocumentType.description: The type of the clinical document.

id.description: The identifier of the document containing the evidence.

text.description: The actual text span which is evidence for the inference.

offset.description: The start index of the evidence text span in the document (0 based).

length.description: The length of the evidence text span.

ClinicalNoteEvidence.description: A piece of evidence from a clinical note (text document).

acceptedGenders.description: A list of genders accepted by a clinical trial.

acceptedAgeRange.description:
A definition of the range of ages accepted by a clinical trial. Contains a
minimum age and/or a maximum age.

ClinicalTrialDemographics.description: Demographic criteria for a clinical trial.

minimumAge.description: A person's age, given as a number (value) and a unit (e.g. years, months)

maximumAge.description: A person's age, given as a number (value) and a unit (e.g. years, months)

ClinicalTrialDemographicsAcceptedAgeRang.description:
A definition of the range of ages accepted by a clinical trial. Contains a
minimum age and/or a maximum age.

id.description:
A given identifier for the clinical trial. Has to be unique within a list of
clinical trials.

eligibilityCriteriaText.description:
The eligibility criteria of the clinical trial (inclusion and exclusion), given
as text.

demographics.description: Demographic criteria for a clinical trial.

metadata.description: Trial data which is of interest to the potential participant.

ClinicalTrialDetails.description: A description of a clinical trial.

phases.description:
Phases which are relevant for the clinical trial.
Each clinical trial can be in a certain phase or in multiple phases.

studyType.description: Possible study types of a clinical trial.

recruitmentStatus.description: Possible recruitment status of a clinical trial.

conditions.description:
Medical conditions and their synonyms which are relevant for the clinical
trial, given as strings.

contacts.description:
Contact details of the trial administrators, for patients that want to
participate in the trial.

facilities.description: Research facilities where the clinical trial is conducted.

ClinicalTrialMetadata.description: Trial data which is of interest to the potential participant.

ClinicalTrialPhase.description: Possible phases of a clinical trial.

ClinicalTrialPurpose.description: Possible purposes of a clinical trial.

ClinicalTrialRecruitmentStatus.description: Possible recruitment status of a clinical trial.

conditions.description:
Trials with any of the given medical conditions will be included in the
selection (provided that other limitations are satisfied). Leaving this list
empty will not limit the medical conditions.

studyTypes.description:
Trials with any of the given study types will be included in the selection
(provided that other limitations are satisfied). Leaving this list empty will
not limit the study types.

recruitmentStatuses.description:
Trials with any of the given recruitment statuses will be included in the
selection (provided that other limitations are satisfied). Leaving this list
empty will not limit the recruitment statuses.

sponsors.description:
Trials with any of the given sponsors will be included in the selection
(provided that other limitations are satisfied). Leaving this list empty will
not limit the sponsors.

phases.description:
Trials with any of the given phases will be included in the selection (provided
that other limitations are satisfied). Leaving this list empty will not limit
the phases.

purposes.description:
Trials with any of the given purposes will be included in the selection
(provided that other limitations are satisfied). Leaving this list empty will
not limit the purposes.

ids.description:
Trials with any of the given identifiers will be included in the selection
(provided that other limitations are satisfied). Leaving this list empty will
not limit the trial identifiers.

sources.description:
Trials with any of the given sources will be included in the selection
(provided that other limitations are satisfied). Leaving this list empty will
not limit the sources.

facilityNames.description:
Trials with any of the given facility names will be included in the selection
(provided that other limitations are satisfied). Leaving this list empty will
not limit the trial facility names.

facilityLocations.description:
Trials with any of the given facility locations will be included in the
selection (provided that other limitations are satisfied). Leaving this list
empty will not limit the trial facility locations.

facilityAreas.description:
Trials with any of the given facility area boundaries will be included in the
selection (provided that other limitations are satisfied). Leaving this list
empty will not limit the trial facility area boundaries.

ClinicalTrialRegistryFilter.description:
A filter defining a subset of clinical trials from a given clinical trial
registry (e.g. clinicaltrials.gov).

ClinicalTrialResearchFacility.description: Details of a research facility where a clinical trial is conducted.

ClinicalTrialSource.description: Possible sources of a clinical trial.

ClinicalTrialStudyType.description: Possible study types of a clinical trial.

registryFilters.description:
A list of filters, each one creating a selection of trials from a given
clinical trial registry.

ClinicalTrials.description:
The clinical trials that the patient(s) should be matched to.
The trial selection can be given as a list of custom clinical trials and/or a list of filters to known clinical trial registries. In case both are given, the resulting trial set is a union of the two sets.

sourceType.description:
The type of the content's source.
In case the source type is 'inline', the content is given as a string (for instance, text).
In case the source type is 'reference', the content is given as a URI.

value.description:
The content of the document, given either inline (as a string) or as a
reference (URI).

DocumentContent.description: The content of the patient document.

DocumentContentSourceType.description:
The type of the content's source.
In case the source type is 'inline', the content is given as a string (for instance, text).
In case the source type is 'reference', the content is given as a URI.

DocumentType.description:
The type of the patient document, such as 'note' (text document) or
'fhirBundle' (FHIR JSON document).

target.description: Target of the particular error (e.g., the name of the property in error)

details.description: A list of related errors that occurred during the request.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information about the error.

system.description: The clinical coding system, e.g. ICD-10, SNOMED-CT, UMLS.

code.description: The code within the given clinical coding system.

name.description: The name of this coded concept in the coding system.

value.description: A value associated with the code within the given clinical coding system.

semanticType.description:
The [UMLS semantic
type](https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/META3_current_semantic_types.html)
associated with the coded concept.

category.description:
The bio-medical category related to the coded concept, e.g. Diagnosis, Symptom,
Medication, Examination.

ExtendedClinicalCodedElement.description:
A piece of clinical information, expressed as a code in a clinical coding
system, extended by semantic information.

value.description: The value of the inference, as relevant for the given inference type.

description.description: The description corresponding to the inference value.

Inference.description: An inference made by the model regarding a patient.

patientDataEvidence.description: A piece of evidence from a clinical note (text document).

patientInfoEvidence.description:
A piece of clinical information, expressed as a code in a clinical coding
system.

importance.description: A value indicating how important this piece of evidence is for the inference.

InferenceEvidence.description: A piece of evidence corresponding to an inference.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information about the error.

InnerError.description: An object containing more specific information about the error.

JobStatus.description: The status of the processing job.

Location.description:
A location given as a combination of city/state/country. It could specify a city, a state or a country.
In case a city is specified, either state + country or country (for countries where there are no states) should be added. In case a state is specified (without a city), country should be added.

LongRunningAcceptedResponse.description: The request was accepted and a job was created.

verbose.description: An indication whether the model should produce verbose output.

includeEvidence.description:
An indication whether the model's output should include evidence for the
inferences.

ModelConfiguration.description: General configuration common to all models.

value.description: The value of the inference, as relevant for the given inference type.

description.description: The description corresponding to the inference value.

caseId.description:
An identifier for a clinical case, if there are multiple clinical cases
regarding the same patient.

OncoPhenotypeInference.description: An inference made by the Onco Phenotype model regarding a patient.

OncoPhenotypeInferenceType.description: The type of the Onco Phenotype inference.

verbose.description: An indication whether the model should produce verbose output.

includeEvidence.description:
An indication whether the model's output should include evidence for the
inferences.

inferenceTypes.description:
A list of inference types to be inferred for the current request.
This could be used if only part of the Onco Phenotype inferences are required. If this list is omitted or empty, the model will return all the inference types.

checkForCancerCase.description:
An indication whether to perform a preliminary step on the patient's documents
to determine whether they relate to a Cancer case.

OncoPhenotypeModelConfiguration.description: Configuration affecting the Onco Phenotype model's inference.

id.description: The identifier given for the patient in the request.

inferences.description: The model's inferences for the given patient.

OncoPhenotypePatientResult.description: The results of the model's work for a single patient.

patients.description: The list of patients, including their clinical information and data.

configuration.description: Configuration affecting the Onco Phenotype model's inference.

OncoPhenotypeRequest.description: The body of the Onco Phenotype request.

createdDateTime.description: The date and time when the processing job was created.

expirationDateTime.description: The date and time when the processing job is set to expire.

lastUpdateDateTime.description: The date and time when the processing job was last updated.

status.description: The status of the processing job.

errors.description: An array of errors, if any errors occurred during the processing job.

results.description: The inference results for the Onco Phenotype request.

OncoPhenotypeResponse.description: The response for the Onco Phenotype request.

patients.description: Results for the patients given in the request.

modelVersion.description: The version of the model used for inference, expressed as the model date.

OncoPhenotypeResults.description: The inference results for the Onco Phenotype request.

id.description:
A given identifier for the patient. Has to be unique across all patients in a
single request.

info.description:
Patient structured information, including demographics and known structured
clinical information.

data.description: Patient unstructured clinical data, given as documents.

Patient.description: A patient record, including their clinical information and data.

type.description:
The type of the patient document, such as 'note' (text document) or
'fhirBundle' (FHIR JSON document).

clinicalType.description: The type of the clinical document.

id.description:
A given identifier for the document. Has to be unique across all documents for
a single patient.

language.description: A 2 letter ISO 639-1 representation of the language of the document.

createdDateTime.description: The date and time when the document was created.

content.description: The content of the patient document.

PatientDocument.description:
A clinical document related to a patient. Document here is in the wide sense -
not just a text document (note).

clinicalInfo.description: Known clinical information for the patient, structured.

PatientInfo.description:
Patient structured information, including demographics and known structured
clinical information.

RepeatabilityResult.description:
"The result of a repeatable request (`accepted`/`rejected`), as specified in 
[OASIS Repeatable Requests Version 1.0](https://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/repeatable-requests/v1.0/cs01/repeatable-requests-v1.0-cs01.html#sec_RepeatabilityResult).

patients.description: The list of patients, including their clinical information and data.

Request.description: The generic part of the Health Decision Support request, common to all models.

createdDateTime.description: The date and time when the processing job was created.

expirationDateTime.description: The date and time when the processing job is set to expire.

lastUpdateDateTime.description: The date and time when the processing job was last updated.

status.description: The status of the processing job.

errors.description: An array of errors, if any errors occurred during the processing job.

Response.description: The generic part of the Health Decision Support response, common to all models.

value.description: The value of the inference, as relevant for the given inference type.

description.description: The description corresponding to the inference value.

id.description: The identifier of the clinical trial.

source.description: Possible sources of a clinical trial.

metadata.description: Trial data which is of interest to the potential participant.

TrialMatcherInference.description: An inference made by the Trial Matcher model regarding a patient.

patientDataEvidence.description: A piece of evidence from a clinical note (text document).

patientInfoEvidence.description:
A piece of clinical information, expressed as a code in a clinical coding
system.

importance.description: A value indicating how important this piece of evidence is for the inference.

eligibilityCriteriaEvidence.description: A piece of evidence from the eligibility criteria text of a clinical trial.

TrialMatcherInferenceEvidence.description: A piece of evidence corresponding to a Trial Matcher inference.

TrialMatcherInferenceType.description: The type of the Trial Matcher inference.

verbose.description: An indication whether the model should produce verbose output.

includeEvidence.description:
An indication whether the model's output should include evidence for the
inferences.

clinicalTrials.description:
The clinical trials that the patient(s) should be matched to.
The trial selection can be given as a list of custom clinical trials and/or a list of filters to known clinical trial registries. In case both are given, the resulting trial set is a union of the two sets.

TrialMatcherModelConfiguration.description: Configuration affecting the Trial Matcher model's inference.

id.description: The identifier given for the patient in the request.

inferences.description: The model's inferences for the given patient.

neededClinicalInfo.description:
Clinical information which is needed to provide better trial matching results
for the patient.

TrialMatcherPatientResult.description: The results of the model's work for a single patient.

patients.description: The list of patients, including their clinical information and data.

configuration.description: Configuration affecting the Trial Matcher model's inference.

TrialMatcherRequest.description: The body of the Trial Matcher request.

createdDateTime.description: The date and time when the processing job was created.

expirationDateTime.description: The date and time when the processing job is set to expire.

lastUpdateDateTime.description: The date and time when the processing job was last updated.

status.description: The status of the processing job.

errors.description: An array of errors, if any errors occurred during the processing job.

results.description: The inference results for the Trial Matcher request.

TrialMatcherResponse.description: The response for the Trial Matcher request.

patients.description: Results for the patients given in the request.

modelVersion.description: The version of the model used for inference, expressed as the model date.

knowledgeGraphLastUpdateDate.description: The date when the clinical trials knowledge graph was last updated.

TrialMatcherResults.description: The inference results for the Trial Matcher request.

Azure.Core.Foundations.ApiVersionParamet.name: api-version
Azure.Core.Foundations.ApiVersionParamet.description: The API version to use for this operation.

RepeatabilityRequestHeaders.repeatabilit.name: repeatabilityFirstSent
RepeatabilityRequestHeaders.repeatabilit.description:
An optional header, one of two request headers required to facilitate the ability to retry requests without the server executing the request multiple times (see [OASIS Repeatable Requests Version 1.0](https://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/repeatable-requests/v1.0/cs01/repeatable-requests-v1.0-cs01.html#sec_RepeatabilityFirstSent)).
This header is used to specify the date and time at which the request was first created. The value must be expressed using the IMF-fixdate form of HTTP-date as defined in [RFC 7231](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231), e.g. `Mon, 03 Jan 2022 09:25:37 GMT`.

RepeatabilityRequestHeaders.repeatabilit.name: repeatabilityRequestId
RepeatabilityRequestHeaders.repeatabilit.description:
An optional header, one of two request headers required to facilitate the ability to retry requests without the server executing the request multiple times (see [OASIS Repeatable Requests Version 1.0](https://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/repeatable-requests/v1.0/cs01/repeatable-requests-v1.0-cs01.html#sec_RepeatabilityRequestID)).
The value should be an opaque string representing a client-generated, globally unique for all time, identifier for the request. It is recommended to use version 4 (random) UUIDs (see [RFC 4122](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4122)).
